channel.title: Tech & Code Podcasts
channel.itunes:author: Anubhav Saini
channel.description: A curated collection of technology, design, and programming podcasts exploring the cutting edge of software development.

item.title: Code Conversations: Modern JavaScript Frameworks
item.itunes:title: Modern JavaScript Frameworks
item.description: In this episode, we discuss the latest developments in JavaScript frameworks and how they're shaping web development in 2025. We dive into the evolution of React, Vue, Svelte, and other frameworks that are pushing the boundaries of what's possible on the web. Featuring special guest Sarah Drasner from the Vue.js core team.

item.title: Code Conversations: Database Architecture
item.itunes:title: Database Architecture
item.description: Learn about modern database architecture, NoSQL vs SQL debates, and how to choose the right database for your project. We explore real-world case studies of database design challenges and how companies like Netflix, Spotify, and Airbnb approach data scalability. Topics include sharding strategies, ACID compliance, eventual consistency, and more.

item.title: Code Conversations: AI in Software Engineering
item.itunes:title: AI in Software Engineering
item.description: How AI is transforming the way we write, test, and maintain code. From pair programming with large language models to automated code reviews and intelligent refactoring. We discuss practical applications of AI tools in everyday development workflows and how to integrate them effectively.

item.title: Design Dialogues: UX Research Methods
item.itunes:title: UX Research Methods
item.description: This episode covers practical UX research methods you can implement with limited resources and time constraints. Learn how to conduct effective user interviews, usability tests, and surveys that provide actionable insights. We emphasize lightweight approaches that deliver maximum value without complex setups or expensive tools.

item.title: Design Dialogues: Color Theory in Digital Products
item.itunes:title: Color Theory in Digital Products
item.description: Understanding how color impacts user perception, accessibility considerations, and creating effective color palettes for digital products. We explore color psychology, creating accessible contrast ratios, designing for color blindness, and how to create cohesive color systems that enhance user experience while maintaining brand identity.

item.title: Design Dialogues: Design Systems at Scale
item.itunes:title: Design Systems at Scale
item.description: How to build, maintain, and scale design systems that work for product teams of all sizes. We cover component architecture, documentation strategies, governance models, and adoption techniques. Learn from case studies of successful design systems at companies like Airbnb, IBM, and Spotify.

item.title: Tech Visuals: AI Model Visualization
item.itunes:title: AI Model Visualization
item.description: A visual exploration of how modern AI models process and understand data, with interactive demonstrations. This video episode provides a clear, visual explanation of complex neural network architectures, attention mechanisms, and how information flows through transformer models. Includes animated visualizations that make these concepts accessible to technical and non-technical audiences alike.

item.title: Tech Visuals: Data Center Architecture
item.itunes:title: Data Center Architecture
item.description: Take a virtual tour of modern data centers and learn about the physical infrastructure that powers the cloud. This video episode provides an insider's look at server rack design, cooling systems, power management, and networking infrastructure. Featuring footage from Google, Amazon, and Microsoft data centers with expert commentary on sustainability initiatives.

item.title: Tech Visuals: Quantum Computing Explained
item.itunes:title: Quantum Computing Explained
item.description: A visual guide to quantum computing fundamentals, making complex quantum concepts accessible through animation and visualization. This video breaks down qubits, superposition, entanglement, and quantum gates with clear, engaging visuals. Includes an overview of quantum algorithms and their potential impact on cryptography, optimization problems, and scientific research.

item.title: Dev Toolbox: Git Workflows for Teams
item.itunes:title: Git Workflows for Teams
item.description: Best practices for using Git in team environments, from branching strategies to code review workflows. We discuss Gitflow, trunk-based development, and GitHub Flow, with practical advice on implementing each approach. Includes tips on handling merge conflicts, writing meaningful commit messages, and setting up effective CI/CD pipelines that integrate with your Git workflow.

item.title: Dev Toolbox: Container Orchestration with Kubernetes
item.itunes:title: Container Orchestration with Kubernetes
item.description: A developer's guide to Kubernetes fundamentals and best practices. We break down complex Kubernetes concepts like pods, services, deployments, and ingress controllers in an approachable way. Learn practical tips for container resource management, secrets handling, and implementing effective scaling strategies for your containerized applications.

item.title: The Future of Static Site Generators
item.itunes:title: The Future of Static Site Generators
item.description: A deep dive into how static site generators are evolving, new features on the horizon, and optimization techniques for modern web experiences. We explore the blurring line between static and dynamic sites with technologies like incremental static regeneration, distributed persistent rendering, and edge functions that are reshaping what's possible with "static" sites in 2025.

item.title: WebAssembly Beyond the Browser
item.itunes:title: WebAssembly Beyond the Browser
item.description: Exploring the expanding role of WebAssembly in server-side applications, edge computing, and IoT devices. We discuss how Wasm is enabling new use cases like portable serverless functions, secure plugins, and cross-platform applications. Learn about the WebAssembly System Interface (WASI) and how it's helping Wasm become a universal runtime for secure, high-performance code execution.

item.title: Sustainable Software Engineering
item.itunes:title: Sustainable Software Engineering
item.description: How to measure and reduce the carbon footprint of your applications. This episode explores strategies for creating energy-efficient code, optimizing cloud resource usage, and implementing sustainable development practices. Learn about tools for measuring application carbon impact and practical steps every development team can take to build more environmentally-friendly software.

item.title: Live Coding: Building a React Component Library
item.itunes:title: Live Coding: Building a React Component Library
item.description: Watch a live session of building a reusable React component library from scratch, with best practices for design systems and accessibility. This hands-on tutorial covers component architecture, prop design patterns, styling approaches, and testing strategies. We demonstrate how to set up Storybook for component documentation and implement a11y features from the ground up.

item.title: Deep Dive: Rust for Systems Programming
item.itunes:title: Deep Dive: Rust for Systems Programming
item.description: A visual exploration of Rust's memory safety features and how they compare to C and C++. This video episode walks through ownership, borrowing, and lifetimes with clear visualizations that make these concepts easier to grasp. We build a sample systems program step-by-step, highlighting Rust's safety guarantees while maintaining performance comparable to traditional systems languages.

item.title: Visualizing Algorithms: Sorting and Searching
item.itunes:title: Visualizing Algorithms: Sorting and Searching
item.description: A visual journey through classic computer science algorithms. This video uses clear animations to illustrate how different sorting and searching algorithms work, their time complexity, and practical applications. Algorithms covered include quicksort, merge sort, binary search trees, and graph traversal methods, with interactive examples that help build intuition for algorithm efficiency.
